entries.meaning: Dated form of purr (low murmuring sound as of a cat)
examples: The first — called by Laennec, from its resemblance to the pur of a cat, the purring tremor — is nearly always indicative of a valvular lesion. The second is caused by the to-and-fro motion of a roughened pericardium.

verbs.description: pur (third-person singular simple present purs, present participle purring, simple past and past participle purred)

examples: And there the wild-cat purs amid her brood.
